item.title: Whilst challenging the Government’s funding distribution model - the NIC has not been quite bold enough
item.description: A transport taxation and distribution re-think is surely now also very much due, with the expected pending diminution of the established fuel tax revenue model.
item.author: ed.ltt@landor.co.uk (Peter Stonham)

item.title: Reshaping and rethinking our role, and its delivery
item.description: As we re-appear in a new format, after a summer break, the obvious need for a carefully curated and structured fortnightly take on UK transport has been clearer than ever.
item.author: ed.ltt@landor.co.uk (Peter Stonham)

item.title: Why we must recognise the true impact of climate change in transport appraisal
item.description: ‘Baseline’ forecasts should be urgently revised so they reflect the current trajectory of global warming.
item.author: ed.ltt@landor.co.uk (Phil Goodwin)

item.title: Time to get back to normal and kick-start business as usual?
item.description: The line on a graph called ‘business as usual’ has simply become meaningless. Yes, we plead, let us feel we can lead normal lives, but for planning and forecasting we cannot credibly translate that into a tenable description of normality.
item.author: ed.ltt@landor.co.uk (Phil Goodwin)

item.title: Transport appraisal and planning in a time of imperatives
item.description: All discussion of strategic and local transport planning at present is seen through the lens of the urgent imperatives of the pandemic, which have changed the boundaries of policy in contradictory directions.
item.author: ed.ltt@landor.co.uk (Phil Goodwin)

item.title: Driving change: travel in the 21st century
item.description: Some of the worst mistakes in transport investment have been supported by huge volumes of forecasts, surveys and studies, confidently published with little recognition of their inconsistencies and errors.
item.author: ed.ltt@landor.co.uk (Phil Goodwin)
